page.title: 02Hadley Town Centre
page.content: Hadley town centre has changed since the Hadley By-Pass was built in 1979. The centre is now pedestrianised. The original High Street now stops at the new shopping precinct. The railway line leads to Donnington to the west and Shrewsbury to the east.The trains that go on the line now carry things for the{Army}Depot. Every Wednesday there is an open air {market}in the centre of Hadley. In the centre of Hadley there is a mixture of old and new shops. At the side of the new shopping area there is a{Methodist Church}which is approximately 100 years old. At the western end of the High Street are some recently built old people's dwellings.
